isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: TRW/ROSS-TAS 40, 55, 65 AND 85 - DISASSEMBLE

warning.para: TAS steering gears can weigh up to 110 pounds dry. To prevent possible personal injury or damage to the steering gear, exercise caution when you remove, lift, carry, or fix in a bench vise.

step1.para: Clean and dry the gear before you start to disassemble it.
As you disassemble the gear, clean all parts in clean, OSHA approved solvent, and air blow-dry them only.

warning.para: Do not use gasoline to clean parts. Gasoline can explode, causing serious physical injury.

Never steam clean or high-pressure wash hydraulic steering components. Do not force or abuse closely fitted parts. Use care that bearing and sealing surfaces are not damaged by the assembly and disassembly procedures.

step1.para: Keep each part separate to avoid nicks and burrs.
Discard all seals, O-rings, and gaskets removed from the gear. Replace them with new parts only.
The steering gear should be identified to the vehicle from which it was removed. The poppet adjuster seat and sleeve assemblies are set for that particular vehicle only.
